guiSET.core

Class Button

  • java.lang.Object
    • guiSET.core.Control
      • guiSET.core.TextBased
        • guiSET.core.Button

  • public class Button
extends TextBased
    Basic button template for text or image buttons.
    Author:
    Mc-Zen

        Parameters:

        width - width for label
        height - height for label

      • Button

        Create an image button. Width and height of button will be set to dimensions of given image.
        Parameters:
        image - background image for button

      • Button

        public Button(PImage image,
              float scale)

        image - background image for button
        scale - scale factor for image

    • Method Detail

      • setBackgroundColor

        public void setBackgroundColor(int clr)
        Description copied from class: Control
        Set the plain background color of the element. Actual displayed color can vary if the element is i.e. hovered over.
        Overrides:
        setBackgroundColor in class Control
        Parameters:
        clr - integer rgb color

      • callClickEventOnPress

        public void callClickEventOnPress()
        The click event is called when the button is pressed down. The click event is either called when the button is pressed OR when it is released.
        See Also:
        callClickEventOnRelease()

      • callClickEventOnRelease

        public void callClickEventOnRelease()
        The click event is called when the button is released (default). The click event is either called when the button is pressed OR when it is released.
        See Also:
        callClickEventOnPress()

      • addClickListener

        public void addClickListener(java.lang.String methodName,
                             java.lang.Object target)
        Add a listener for when the button has been clicked.
        Parameters:
        methodName - method name
        target - object

      • addClickListener

        public void addClickListener(Control.Predicate1<MouseEvent> lambda)
        Add a listener lambda for when the button has been clicked. Event arguments: the Button whose state has changed
        Parameters:
        lambda - lambda expression with MouseEvent parameter

      • addClickListener

        public void addClickListener(Control.Predicate lambda)
        Add a listener lambda for when the button has been clicked. Event arguments: none
        Parameters:
        lambda - lambda expression
